conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container E or F after passing through baffles.
Container A has a red baffle positioned diagonally leftward.
Liquid from A encounters the red baffle and is directed leftward, then down the subsequent angled baffles, ultimately reaching the left-hand collection channel.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Container B has a turquoise baffle positioned diagonally rightward.
Liquid from B is guided rightward by the first baffle it meets, then joins the central downward path that feeds into the middle outlet.
Liquid from B flows into container F.
Container C has a pink baffle positioned diagonally rightward.
Liquid from C quickly meets a right-slanted baffle that sends it left and downward through the same pathway as A.
Liquid from C flows into container E.
Container D has a blue baffle positioned diagonally rightward.
Liquid from D is immediately sent rightward by its first baffle, then continues down the right-slanted sequence to the middle outlet.
Liquid from D flows into container F.
